required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunogenicity and Safety of GSK Biologicals' Live Attenuated Varicella Vaccine (VARILRIXTM).
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Open-label, Multi-centre Study to Assess the Immunogenicity and Safety of GlaxoSmithKline Biologicals' Live Attenuated Varicella Vaccine (VarilrixTM), Given as a Primary Vaccination at 4.5 Months and 6.5 Months Post-transplantation, in Autologous Stem Cell/ Bone Marrow Transplant Recipients Aged 18 Years and Older.

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess the immunogenicity and safety of varicella vaccination in a population of autologous peripheral stem cell/ bone marrow transplantation recipients who have reached at least four months post-transplantation.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Varicella Vaccine Response
primary_outcome.time_frame: At 8 months post-transplantation = 1.5 months post-second dose of vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: for initially seropositive subjects, an antibody titer at Month 8 post-transplantation above or equal to (≥) 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At 8 months post-transplantation = 1.5 months post-second dose of vaccination
primary_outcome.description: Antibody titers were measured by Indirect Immunofluorescence Assay (IFA) and presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With a Varicella Vaccine Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 6.5 months post-transplantation = 2 months post first dose of vaccination
secondary_outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: for initially seropositive subjects, antibody titer at 6.5 months post-transplantation ≥ 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Seropositive Subjects for Anti-varicella Antibodies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-transplantation (Month 0), pre-vaccination visit (at 4.5 months post-transplantation), Month 12 and Month 24 (5.5 and 17.5 months post-second dose of vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: The seropositivity cut-off titer of the assay was an anti-VZV antibody titer greater than or equal to (≥) 1:4.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-transplantation (Month 0), pre-vaccination visit (4.5 months post-transplantation), Month 12 and Month 24 (5.5 and 17.5 post-second dose of vaccination)
secondary_outcome.description: Antibody titers were were measured by Indirect Immunofluorescence Assay (IFA) and presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 8-day (Days 0-7) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 20 millimeters (mm) of injection site.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Fever
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 43-day (Days 0-42) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Any = fever equal to or greater than (≥) 37.5 °C. Grade 3 fever = fever above (>) 39.0 °C. Related = fever assessed by the investigator as related to the vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any and Related Rash
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 43-day (Days 0-42) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: Rash was assessed as being either associated to the administration site or not. Non administration site rash was presented by following characteristics (with fever, measles/rubella like, varicella like and related).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the 43-day (Days 0-42) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
secondary_outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the active phase of the study (up to Month 24)
secondary_outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.

arm_group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltiod region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

intervention.description: Subcutaneous injection, 2 doses, in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Screening phase:
- A male or female ≥ 18 years of age at the time of study entry.
- Written informed consent obtained from the subject prior to study entry.
- Patients who are planned to undergo autologous peripheral stem cell/ bone marrow transplantation.
- Subjects who the investigator believes can and will comply with the requirements of the protocol
- If the subject is female, she must be of non-childbearing potential; or, if of childbearing potential, she must be abstinent or have used adequate contraceptive precautions for 30 days prior to vaccination, have a negative pregnancy test and must agree to continue such precautions for 10 months after transplantation.
Active phase:
- Patients who are confirmed to have undergone autologous peripheral stem cell/ bone marrow transplantation.
- If the subject is female, she must be of non-childbearing potential; or, if of childbearing potential, she must be abstinent or have used adequate contraceptive precautions for 30 days prior to vaccination, have a negative pregnancy test and must agree to continue such precautions for 10 months after transplantation.
Exclusion Criteria:
Screening phase:
- Pregnant or lactating female.
- Female planning to become pregnant or planning to discontinue contraceptive precautions in the 10 months post-transplantation.
- History of allergy to any component of the vaccine.
- Patients with difficult to treat disease who are likely to relapse within 6 months post-transplantation.
- Current drug and/or alcohol abuse.
Active phase:
- Use of any investigational or non-registered product (drug or vaccine) during the active phase of the study period.
- Use of immunosuppressants or other immune-modifying drugs within 14 days preceding the administration of the first dose of the study vaccine or planned use during the active phase of the study period.
- Use of rituximab (MabThera) more than 60 days after transplant.
- Administration of a vaccine not foreseen by the study protocol during the period starting from 30 days before each dose of vaccine and ending 30 days after.
- Pregnant or lactating female.
- Female planning to become pregnant or planning to discontinue contraceptive precautions in the 10 months post-transplantation.
- History of allergy to any component of the vaccine
- Patients with VZV disease after transplantation and prior to vaccination.
- Ongoing requirement for antiviral therapy with anti-VZV activity beyond 4 months post-transplantation
- Patients with difficult to treat disease who are likely to relapse within 6 months post-transplantation.
- Current drug and/or alcohol abuse.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.

study_doc.doc_comment: For additional information about this study please refer to the GSK Clinical Study Register

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Subjects in this study were recipients of autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Out of the 45 subjects enrolled in the screening phase of the study, 16 subjects did not receive the study vaccine, as they did not meet eligibility criteria, and were hence eliminated from the study active phase.

group.title: Varilrix Group
group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

group.title: Varilrix Group
group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With a Varicella Vaccine Response
outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: for initially seropositive subjects, an antibody titer at Month 8 post-transplantation above or equal to (≥) 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.
outcome.time_frame: At 8 months post-transplantation = 1.5 months post-second dose of vaccination
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures and assay results for anti-varicella zoster virus (VZV) antibodies for Month 8 time point were available.

group.title: Varilrix Group
group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With a Varicella Vaccine Response
measure.description: Vaccine response was defined as: for initially seropositive subjects, an antibody titer at Month 8 post-transplantation above or equal to (≥) 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures and assay results for anti-varicella zoster virus (VZV) antibodies for Month 8 time point were available.

outcome.title: Anti-varicella Zoster Virus (Anti-VZV) Antibody Titers
outcome.description: Antibody titers were measured by Indirect Immunofluorescence Assay (IFA) and presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).
outcome.time_frame: At 8 months post-transplantation = 1.5 months post-second dose of vaccination
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures and assay results for anti-VZV antibodies for Month 8 time point were available.

group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

measure.description: Antibody titers were measured by Indirect Immunofluorescence Assay (IFA) and presented as geometric mean titers (GMTs).
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures and assay results for anti-VZV antibodies for Month 8 time point were available.

outcome.description: Vaccine response was defined as: for initially seropositive subjects, antibody titer at 6.5 months post-transplantation ≥ 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.
outcome.time_frame: At 6.5 months post-transplantation = 2 months post first dose of vaccination
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures and assay results for anti-VZV antibodies for Month 6.5 time point were available.

group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With a Varicella Vaccine Response
measure.description: Vaccine response was defined as: for initially seropositive subjects, antibody titer at 6.5 months post-transplantation ≥ 4 fold the pre-vaccination antibody titer.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects for whom data concerning immunogenicity measures and assay results for anti-VZV antibodies for Month 6.5 time point were available.

outcome.title: Number of Seropositive Subjects for Anti-varicella Antibodies
outcome.description: The seropositivity cut-off titer of the assay was an anti-VZV antibody titer greater than or equal to (≥) 1:4.
outcome.time_frame: At pre-transplantation (Month 0), pre-vaccination visit (at 4.5 months post-transplantation), Month 12 and Month 24 (5.5 and 17.5 months post-second dose of vaccination)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the According-to-Protocol (ATP) cohort for immunogenicity, which included all evaluable subjects. Only those subjects who provided a serum sample at the specified time point (i.e. with anti-VZV antibody assay results available) were included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any and Grade 3 Solicited Local Adverse Events
outcome.description: Assessed solicited local symptoms were pain, redness and swelling. Any = occurrence of the symptom regardless of intensity grade. Grade 3 pain = pain that prevented normal activity. Grade 3 redness/swelling = redness/swelling spreading beyond 20 millimeters (mm) of injection site.
outcome.time_frame: During the 8-day (Days 0-7) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects with at least one vaccination administered. Five subjects who had not completed their symtpom sheets following dose 2 were not included in the analyses.

group.title: Varilrix Group
group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects with at least one vaccination administered. Five subjects who had not completed their symtpom sheets following dose 2 were not included in the analyses.

class.title: Related non-administration site Rash, Across doses

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
outcome.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
outcome.time_frame: During the 43-day (Days 0-42) post-vaccination period after each dose and across doses
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects with at least one vaccination administered.

group.title: Varilrix Group
group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
measure.description: An unsolicited AE covers any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation subject temporally associated with the use of a medicinal product, whether or not considered related to the medicinal product and reported in addition to those solicited during the clinical study and any solicited symptom with onset outside the specified period of follow-up for solicited symptoms. Any was defined as the occurrence of any unsolicited AE regardless of intensity grade or relation to vaccination.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects with at least one vaccination administered.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
outcome.time_frame: During the active phase of the study (up to Month 24)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the Total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects with at least one vaccination administered.

group.title: Varilrix Group
group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: Serious adverse events (SAEs) assessed include medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization or result in disability/incapacity.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the Total vaccinated cohort, which included subjects with at least one vaccination administered.

reported_events.time_frame: Solicited symptoms: during the 8-day (Days 0-7) post-vaccination period; Unsolicited AEs: during the 43-day (Days 0-42) post-vaccination period; Serious adverse events (SAEs): during the entire study, up to Month 24 post-transplantation.

group.title: Varilrix Group
group.description: Subjects with autologous peripheral stem cell/bone marrow transplants, who received 2 doses of Varilrix vaccine subcutaneously in the deltoid region of the non-dominant upper arm, at 4.5 and 6.5 months post-transplantation.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: GSK agreements may vary with individual investigators, but will not prohibit any investigator from publishing. GSK supports the publication of results from all centers of a multi-center trial but requests that reports based on single-site data not precede the primary publication of the entire clinical trial.
